snippet: Big banks, health care companies and Silicon Valley players were listed in the first official tally by the Center for American Progress, founded by President Obama’s new adviser.
abstract: First official tally of corporate donors of left-leaning Center for American Progress reveals that big banks, lobbying firms, health care companies and major Silicon Valley players are among its corporate sponsors; disclosure comes after debate in Washington over whether such corporate donations result in policy papers and opinion pieces that move corporate agendas.
lead_paragraph: Big banks, health care companies and Silicon Valley players were listed in the first official tally by the Center for American Progress, founded by President Obama’s new adviser.

headline.main: Think Tank Plays Down Role of Donors
headline.print_headline: Think Tank Plays Down Role of Donors
